verse.roman:
maṇḍalāni vicitrāṇi
savyaṁ dakṣiṇam eva ca
caratoḥ śuśubhe yuddhaṁ
naṭayor iva raṅgiṇoḥ

synonyms: maṇḍalāni—arcs; vicitrāṇi—skillful; savyam—to the left; dakṣiṇam—to the right; eva ca—also; caratoḥ—of them who were moving; śuśubhe—appeared splendid; yuddham—the fight; naṭayoḥ—of actors; iva—like; raṅgiṇoḥ—on a stage.
translation: As they skillfully circled left and right, like actors dancing on a stage, the fight presented a magnificent spectacle.

purport.text: Jarāsandha and Bhīma here demonstrate their expertise in the use of clubs. Thus it can be understood that both fighters were fearless and steady even in the rage of battle.
